page.title: 05LHANBRYDE _LANDSCAPE
page.content:
As the{Moray Firth Ice Sheet} moved west its meltwaters flowed northwards, along the ice edge down the{Blackhills Channel,}to{Loch_na_bo just south east of the village.
{* * * The area then looked very different, with mounds of sand and stones and small kettle hole lochs (where huge chunks of ice had melted and left hollows in the surface of the land). { { * * * Around{Loch_na_bo}and{Loch Oire},two partly artificial lochs,you can see some really good examples of{mounds and{kettle holes}. Now these pretty lochs are surrounded by pine woods and lush green grass.
